channel.title: til unix jq on
channel.description: Recent content in til unix jq on

item.title: jq extracting properties to arrays from JSON row line
item.description: For example if we have a file that contains JSON object like {"a": 1, "b":{"c": 11} {"a": 2, "b":{"c": 22}} {"a": 3, "b":{"c": 33}} And you want to construct something like ["1", "11"] ["2", "22"] ["3", "33"] You can do that with jq $ cat filename.json | jq -c '[.a, .b.c]' this is particularly usefull to grep something from JSON log

item.title: Format or parse json in command line
item.description: To easily format json or command line there jq example $ echo '{"user":"stedolan","titles":["JQ Primer", "More JQ"]}' | jq . { "user": "stedolan", "titles": [ "JQ Primer", "More JQ" ] } or just print specific value $ echo '{"user":"stedolan","titles":["JQ Primer", "More JQ"]}' | jq .titles[0] "JQ Primer"
